header: Meet Remote for Slides, a new way to control your presentation slides
author: Henry Lim
post:
![](https://cdn-images-1.medium.com/max/1000/1*mhNT5I7cVuxezmWyFPMA4g.jpeg) 

 Say hello to Remote for Slides (formerly known as Remote for Google Slides) — a [Chrome Extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/remote-for-google-slides/pojijacppbhikhkmegdoechbfiiibppi?utm=medium) and a [Progressive Web App](https://slides.limhenry.xyz/?utm=medium) that allows you to control Google Slides and [Ludus](https://ludus.one/) on any device, remotely, without the need for any extra hardware. 

 ## Easy to use 

 Remote for Slides is very easy to use. To get started, install the Chrome extension from the [Chrome Web Store](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/remote-for-google-slides/pojijacppbhikhkmegdoechbfiiibppi?utm=medium), open Google Slides in presentation mode, a six-digits PIN will show on the screen. Enter the PIN on [s.limhenry.xyz](http://s.limhenry.xyz/), and you are ready to go! 

 ## Speaker Notes and Timer 

 We introduced two new features in the latest update — speaker notes and timer. We added speaker notes, so you can refer to your notes during your presentation. To make sure you can keep track of time, we also added a timer on the bottom of the web application. We want you to have a successful presentation! 

 ![](https://cdn-images-1.medium.com/max/1000/1*5Falt5uphgpMOx708XwnIQ.jpeg)*Remote for Google Slides works on everywhere — all you need is a browser* 

 Remote for Slides is now available on [Chrome Web Store](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/remote-for-google-slides/pojijacppbhikhkmegdoechbfiiibppi?utm=medium). We’d love to hear what you think. Please let us know how we can improve on Twitter ([@remoteforslides](https://twitter.com/remoteforslides)).
